intro: Psychotria papantlensis, commonly known as the Mexican psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to Mexico and is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and opposite, ovate leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale green flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. It thrives in humid, shaded environments, typically found in tropical rainforests. Psychotria papantlensis is noted for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated for its foliage and unique floral structure.
